raw_qc_flag_meaning: Blank - No quality control (QC) has been performed
Good - QC has been performed: record appears correct
Doubtful - QC has been performed: record appears doubtful
Erroneous - QC has been perfromed: record appears erroneous
Changes - The record has been changed as a result of QC
Acceptable - QC has been performed: record seems inconsistent with other records
Off Position - There is a problem with the buoy position or mooring. Data may still be useful.
Reserved
Reserved - indicates missing elements

Valid, data meets basic profile limits (is also default by WCIS storage system)
Suspect, data does not meet limitations of sensor profile
Edited, data record was manually edited by data editor
Transmission parity error (Applies to continuous winds and non-WPM wave data and DART data)
Missing sensor data (A result of a garbled or missing message)
A WPM wave message is short, missing a checksum, or parity errors are detected
Delete measurement from release and archive
Invalid statistical parameter
Failed time continuity
Failed range limits
Hierarchy reversal has occurred (BARO, WSPD, WDIR only)
A related measurement has failed a hard QC check
Measurement is above monthly, regional limit
Measurement is below monthly, regional limit
Failed standard deviation test (continuous winds only)
Measurement failed hourly time continuity
Failed gust-to-mean wind speed ratio (applies to standard and continuous winds)
Continuous and hourly wind speeds don't agree
One, and only one, transmission error detected in continuous wind string of a message (all continuous wind measurements are flagged, if more than one error detected, then flag is updated to a T flag)
Difference between duplicate measurements is too high
High frequency spikes detected in wave spectrum, WVHGT is flagged
Measurement failed comparison with NCEP model fields
Failed wave height to wave period comparison test
Swell direction is from an improbably direction
Related measurement failed (continuous winds only)
Stuck raw compass (RCOMP and WDIR are flagged)
Tendency difference between duplicate sensors is too high
Failed relative humidity versus visibility check
Failed wind direction versus wave direction check
Wind wave energy is too high for prevailing wind speed
Wind wave energy is too low for prevailing wind speed
Failed bow azimuth versus wind direction check

Hourly solar radiation - Sun is more than 10 degrees above the horizon and the ratio of measured hourly solar radiation to calculated extraterrestrial radiation is equal to or greater than 1.0; the sun is more than 10 degrees above the horizon and the measured hourly solar radiation is equal to or less than 0 Wm-2; the sun is less than 10 degrees above the horizon and the absolute value of measured hourly solar radiation is equal to or greater than 10.00 Wm-2
Hourly solar radiation - Measured hourly solar radiation is less than or equal to -50.00 Wm-2, or is equal to or greater than 4,000 Wm-2

Hourly solar radiation - The sun is more than 10 degrees above the horizon and the ratio of measured hourly solar radiation to calculated extraterrestrial radiation is greater than 0.85; the sun is less than 10 degrees above the horizon and the absolute value of measured hourly radiation is equal to or greater than 6.00 Wm-2
Hourly net radiation - Net radiation is not calculated for this station
Hourly net radiation - Solar radiation is severe (flagged S); two or all three sensors (solar radiation, vapor pressure, and air temperature) are missing
Hourly net radiation - Net radiation is less than -100, or equal to or greater than 800; solar radiation, air temperature, or vapor pressure is flagged R
Hourly net radiation - Solar radiation, air temperature, or vapor pressure is severe; net radiation is equal to or greater than 4,000 Wm-2
Hourly soil temperature - Soil temperature is far out of historical range (outside the 99.8% confidence interval)

Hourly soil temperature - Soil temperature is moderately out of historical range (outside the 96% confidence interval); soil temperature drop or rise between this hour and the previous hour is greater than 3¡C, or 5.4¡F

Hourly air temperature - Air temperature drop or rise between this hour and the previous hour is greater than 10¡C, or 18¡F; air temperature is far out of historical range (outside the 99.8% confidence interval)
Hourly air temperature - Air temperature is constant for 4 hours in a row
Hourly air temperature - Air temperature is moderately out of historical range (outside of 96% confidence interval)
Hourly vapor pressure - Air temperature or precipitation is severe (eitehr or both are flagged S)

Hourly vapor pressure - Vapor pressure is constant for 4 hours in a row; actual vapor pressure is equal to or less than to 0.00 kPa or actual vapor pressure is greater than 1.05 times the saturation vapor pressure
Hourly vapor pressure - Vapor pressure is equal to or less than 0
Hourly vapor pressure - Relative humidity is less than 50% during an hour with 1.00 mm or more of precipitation
Hourly wind speed - Wind speed is equal to or less than 0.447 (1 mph) or wind speed is constant for 4 hours in a row
Hourly wind speed - Wind speed is equal to or less than 0; wind speed is equal to or greater than 45 m/s or 100 mph
Hourly resultant wind - Wind speed is flagged I
Hourly resultant wind - Wind speed is severe
Hourly resultant wind - Resultant wind is equal to or greater than wind speed
Hourly wind direction - Wind direction is less than 0 or greater than 360 degrees
Hourly wind direction - Wind direction is constant for 4 hours in a row
Hourly standard deviation of wind direction - Wind direction is severe; standard dviation of wind direction is between 188 and 189
Hourly standard deviation of wind direction - Wind direction is flagged R; standard deviation of wind speed is equal to or greater than 180 degrees or less than 0

Hourly precipitation - Precipitation is more than 100 mm (4 inches); measured solar radiation is greater than 75% of calculated extraterrestrial radiation, the sun is 10 or more degrees above the horizon, and the station shows recorded precipitation (precipitation is greater than 0)
Hourly precipitation - Precipitation is less than 0

Hourly precipitation - Measured solar radiation is greater than 65% of calculated extraterrestrial radiation, the sun is 10 or more degrees above the horizon, and the station shows recorded precipitation
Hourly evapotranspiration - One or more of the above listed measurements is flagged R; wind speed is flagged I
Hourly evapotranspiration - Precipitation is less than 0
Hourly evapotranspiration - One or more of the above listed measurements is flagged Y
Hourly relative humidity - Air temperature or vapor pressure is severe
Hourly relative humidity - Air temperature or vapor pressure is flagged R
Hourly relative humidity - Air temperature or vapor pressure is flagged Y
Dew point temperature - Relative humidity is flagged Q
Dew point temperature - Relative humidity is flagged R
Dew point temperature - Relative humidity is flagged Y
